author: silksteele
title: Fractional minting application
description: Game developers need NFT-based systems and tools that are audited, certified, and battle-tested.

f6_assessments.q0: It is unclear how a "fractional minting application" fits into the "gamers on-chained" challenge and what problem it specifically solves. Multiple bullet points are explicitly stated under the proposal's impact section without any further explanation. The mix of clear, though not detailed, tasks (e.g. creation of an utility token that's compatible with any project using Cardano native tokens) and lofty goals (e.g. play a significant role in the Cardano gaming community) are too far apart to even understand what this proposal is about.
f6_assessments.q1: As a former intern at MLabs, I do not believe that the budget will be enough to drive from start to finish that has any meaningful impact on the Cardano ecosystem. The Github history of the proposer is short and does not showcase any significant involvement in relevant repositories.
f6_assessments.q2: Some success metrics are provided but lack clarity (e.g. what does successful growth of the development team look like? How does this fit into the budget?). Is the code going to be open sourced from the beginning or after the fact? I strongly disagree that this proposal shows clarity and auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: DC spark has in fact a proposal in fund 7 for a full audit of the fracada SC and additionally a btach version of the same contract therefore I whilst this proposal holds great value I believe it should be defered to the authors of the actual SC. I believe instead the proposal should focus on Rasayana which in itself sounds like an exciting idea.
f6_assessments.q1: Mlabs has the requisite skills to audit the SC however once again I believe that it should be defered to DC spark.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is well laid out but does not mention specifically the proposal and the requested funds but rather the greater scope of Rasayana. As it is just the the fractional mintin tool that is being fund requested I believe the should be a deeper analysis on what success there looks like.

f6_assessments.q0: First of all, I am not a developer so I am only judging this proposal based on its other merits. First difficulty comes from the fact that a) the proposer has been provided with plenty of useful feedback in the comments section but not all of it has been incorporated into the proposal, and b) the proposal is dotted with terminology that should have been opened up more. I did take a look at what Fracada is (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8FvKUlh7Fs8) but it would have been useful to open up what this "fractional minting application" is supposed to achieve and how. After doing some more research into the topic I understand that something like this would probably be useful for many projects in the Cardano ecosystem. This reasoning should have just been spelled out in the proposal itself.
f6_assessments.q1: Based on how the proposal (and budget) is written, it appears that the proposer doesn't take any of the money himself but instead pays MLabs and a yet unidentified UX/UI designer to get the job done. Due to the reputation and high profile of MLabs team, it is almost certain that whatever they take up will get done up to the highest standard. What is unclear, however, is the proposer's own participation and expertise.
f6_assessments.q2: The first use case for the envisioned fractionalized minting application is the proposer's "Rasayana NFT project" which, however, is not explained in detail. As "Successful funding from Catalyst Fund 7" is mentioned as one of the 3-month objectives, it is fair to assume that the development has already started and the other 3-month objectives should be achieved with or without Catalyst funding. Should that not be the case, I wish the founder the best of luck in growing the developer team and welcome new and more detailed proposals in the coming Funds. As it stands, it seems quite hard to audit the progress of this proposal.

solution: Iterative Alchemy Labs will build an open-source plug-and-play fractional minting tool based on the Fracada protocol.
